hero.headline: Farm-to-Table Mexican Cuisine
hero.subheadline: Modern Mexican dishes crafted from locally sourced ingredients, served in the heart of Austin's East Side. Brunch weekends, dinner nightly, cocktails always.

items.caption: Wood-fired elote with cotija and lime aioli
Our signature mole negro — 28 ingredients, three days to prepare
The main dining room with reclaimed oak and open kitchen
Hand-pressed blue corn tortillas made fresh every hour
Mezcal flight with house-smoked sal de gusano
Our shaded patio overlooking Rainey Street
Brunch chilaquiles with sunny eggs and crema
Chef Ana at the pass during Friday dinner service

items.quote: The mole negro alone is worth the trip to Austin. Thirty minutes in and I was already planning my next visit. This kitchen is doing something special.
We hosted our rehearsal dinner here for 40 guests. Chef Ana created a custom tasting menu that had everyone talking long after the wedding. Impeccable service.
Best brunch in East Austin, no contest. The chilaquiles are incredible and the horchata cold brew is dangerously good. Get there early — the wait is real.
As a vegetarian, I often feel like an afterthought at Mexican restaurants. Not here. Half the menu works for me and every dish tastes intentional, not adapted.

pricing.headline: The Menu
pricing.subheadline: Seasonal dishes made with ingredients from Central Texas farms and ranches. Menu changes weekly — these are our current favorites.

features.text: Wood-Fired Elote — cotija, lime aioli, chili crisp — $9
Ceviche Tostadas — gulf shrimp, avocado, habanero tiger's milk — $14
Queso Fundido — Oaxaca cheese, chorizo, house tortillas — $12
Guacamole Trio — classic, mango-habanero, roasted garlic — $11
Sopa de Tortilla — ancho broth, avocado, crema — $8
Mole Negro — free-range chicken, 28-ingredient mole, sesame — $26
Brisket Barbacoa Tacos — 14-hr smoked brisket, pickled onion, salsa verde — $18
Catch of the Day — grilled with mango-chipotle glaze, black beans, rice — $24
Carnitas Plate — crispy Berkshire pork, pineapple salsa, hand-pressed tortillas — $22
Enchiladas Suizas — roasted poblano, tomatillo crema, queso fresco — $19
Grilled Cauliflower Steak — mole rojo, pepitas, pickled chili (V) — $18
Oaxacan Old Fashioned — mezcal, agave, mole bitters — $15
Tamarind Margarita — reposado tequila, tamarind, lime, Tajín rim — $14
Horchata Cold Brew — house horchata, cold brew, cinnamon — $7
Paloma Fresca — blanco tequila, grapefruit, soda, rosemary — $13
Mezcal Flight — three selections with sal de gusano — $22
